t: Proverbs 28
Warnings and Instructions
The*pn wicked flee when no one is pursuing, But*ln the righteous are bold as a lion.
By*ln the transgression of a land many are its princes, But*ln by a man of understanding and*i knowledge, so it endures.
A*ln poor man who oppresses the lowly Is*ln like*i a driving rain which leaves no food.
Those*ln who forsake the law praise the wicked, But*ln those who keep the law strive with them.
Evil*ln men do not understand justice, But*ln those who seek the Lord*s understand all things.
Better*ln is the poor who walks in his integrity Than*ln he who is crooked though he be rich.
He*ln who keeps the law is a discerning son, But*ln he who is a companion of gluttons humiliates his father.
He*ln who increases his wealth by interest and usury Gathers*ln it for him who is gracious to the poor.
He*ln who turns away his ear from listening to the law, Even*ln his prayer is an abomination.
He*ln who leads the upright astray in an evil way Will*ln himself fall into his own pit, But*ln the blameless will inherit good.
The*ln rich man is wise in his own eyes, But*ln the poor who has understanding sees through him.
When*ln the righteous triumph, there is great glory, But*ln when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.
He*ln who conceals his transgressions will not prosper, But*ln he who confesses and forsakes them*i will find compassion.
How*ln blessed is the man who fears always, But*ln he who hardens his heart will fall into calamity.
Like*iln a roaring lion and a rushing bear Is*ln a wicked ruler over a poor people.
A*ln leader who is a great oppressor lacks understanding, But*iln he who hates unjust gain will prolong his*i days.
A*ln man who is laden with the guilt of human blood Will*ln be a fugitive until death; let no one support him.
He*ln who walks blamelessly will be delivered, But*ln he who is crooked will fall all at once.
He*ln who tills his land will have plenty of food, But*ln he who follows empty pursuits*i will have poverty in plenty.
A*ln faithful man will abound with blessings, But*ln he who makes haste to be rich will not go unpunished.
To*ln show partiality is not good, Because*ln for a piece of bread a man will transgress.
A*ln man with an evil eye hastens after wealth And*ln does not know that want will come upon him.
He*ln who rebukes a man will afterward find more*i favor Than*ln he who flatters with the tongue.
He*ln who robs his father or his mother And*ln says, “It is not a transgression,” Is*ln the companion of a man who destroys.
An*ln arrogant man stirs up strife, But*ln he who trusts in the Lord*s will prosper.
He*ln who trusts in his own heart is a fool, But*ln he who walks wisely will be delivered.
He*ln who gives to the poor will never want, But*ln he who shuts his eyes will have many curses.
When*ln the wicked rise, men hide themselves; But*ln when they perish, the righteous increase.
